colorado.aims_tools.bucket_aims_to_volume_aims(aims_bucket, pad=0)¶

Transform a bucket into a 3d boolean volume. Input and output types are aims objects

colorado.aims_tools.bucket_numpy_to_volume_aims(bucket_array, pad=0)¶

Transform a bucket into a 3d boolean volume. Input and output types are numpy.ndarray

colorado.aims_tools.bucket_numpy_to_volume_numpy(bucket_array, pad=0)¶

Transform a bucket into a 3d boolean volume. Input and output types are numpy.ndarray

colorado.aims_tools.bucket_to_mesh(bucket, gaussian_blur_FWWM=0.2, threshold=0, decimation_params={'feature_angle': 180, 'max_clearance': 3, 'max_error': 1, 'reduction_rate': 99}, smoothing_params={'iterations': 30, 'rate': 0.4, 'type': 'lowpass'})¶

Create a mesh from a bucket

Parameters:
  • bucket (np.ndarray or aims.Volume) – sequence of 3D points.
  • gaussian_blur_FWWM (numeric) – the gaussian blur filter’s full with at half maximum.
  • threshold (float in [0,1]) – voxel below this value will be set to zero (1 represents the maximum of the voxel values)
  • decimation_params (dict, optional) – decimation parameters. reduction_rate : expected % decimation reduction rate max_clearance : maximum clearance of the decimation max_error : maximum error distance from the original mesh (mm) feature_angle : feature angle (degrees), between 0 and 180
  • smoothing_params (dict, optional) – smoothing parameters type : smoothing alorithm’s type (laplacian, simplespring, polygonspring or lowpass) iterations : smoothing number of iterations rate : smoothing moving rate at each iteration
Returns:

A mesh obtained from the input volume
Return type:

aims Mesh
colorado.aims_tools.ndarray_to_aims_volume(ndarray)¶

Create a new volume with the data in ndarray.

The array is first converted to Fortran ordering, as requested by the Volume constructor.

colorado.aims_tools.ndarray_to_volume_aims(ndarray)¶

Create a new volume from the numpy ndarray. The array is first converted to Fortran ordering, as requested by the Volume constructor

Parameters:ndarray (numpy.ndarray) – the volume data
Returns:an Aims Volume object containing the same data as ndarray
Return type:aims.Volume
colorado.aims_tools.new_volume_aims_like(vol)¶

Create a new empty aims.Volume with the same shape as vol

Parameters:vol (np.ndarray) – the volume data
Returns:an empty Aims Volume object of the same shape as vol
Return type:aims.Volume
colorado.aims_tools.volume_to_bucket_aims(volume)¶
colorado.aims_tools.volume_to_bucket_numpy(volume)¶

Transform a binary volume into a bucket. The bucket contains the coordinates of the non-zero voxels in volume.

Parameters:volume (numpy array | aims volume) – 3D image
Returns:bucket of non-zero points coordinates
Return type:numpy.ndarray
colorado.aims_tools.volume_to_mesh(volume, gaussian_blur_FWWM=0.2, threshold=0, mesh_decimation_params={'feature_angle': 180, 'max_clearance': 3, 'max_error': 1, 'reduction_rate': 99}, mesh_smoothing_params={'iterations': 30, 'rate': 0.4, 'type': 'lowpass'})¶

Create a mesh from a volume.

Before calculating the mesh, the volume is first blurred with a gaussian filter and then thresholded.

Parameters:
  • volume (np.ndarray or aims.Volume) – 3D binary image (if not binary, all vxels != 0 are set to 1)
  • gaussian_blur_FWWM (numeric) – the gaussian blur filter’s full with at half maximum.
  • threshold (float in [0,1]) – voxel below this value will be set to zero (1 represents the maximum of the voxel values)
  • decimation_params (dict, optional) – decimation parameters. reduction_rate : expected % decimation reduction rate max_clearance : maximum clearance of the decimation max_error : maximum error distance from the original mesh (mm) feature_angle : feature angle (degrees), between 0 and 180
  • smoothing_params (dict, optional) – smoothing parameters type : smoothing alorithm’s type (laplacian, simplespring, polygonspring or lowpass) iterations : smoothing number of iterations rate : smoothing moving rate at each iteration
Returns:

A mesh obtained from the input volume
Return type:

aims Mesh
colorado.aims_tools.volume_to_ndarray(volume)¶

Transform aims volume in numpy array

Parameters:volume (aims.volume) – aims volume

colorado.bucket module¶

colorado.bucket.draw_numpy_bucket(bucket)¶

Draw one bucket from numpy array

Parameters:bucket (numpy.ndarray, shape (N,3)) – bucket
Returns:a plotly figure representing the bucket
Return type:plotly.graphic_objects.Figure
colorado.bucket.draw_numpy_buckets(list_of_buckets, labels=None, transpose=True, x_shift=0, fig=None)¶

Draw buckets from numpy arrays.

Parameters:
  • list_of_buckets (Sequence[numpy.ndarray]) – a list of arrays representing the buckets to plot. Each array must be a Nx3 numpy.ndarray containing the coordinates of N points
  • transpose (bool, optional) – for plot reasons, transpose each bucket array if True, defaults to True
  • x_shift (num, optional) – Amount of x shift to add to each sulcus, defaults to 0

colorado.mesh module¶

colorado.mesh.draw_meshes_in_subplots(mesh_list, cols=3)¶

Draw meshes in a subplot grid.

Parameters:
  • mesh_list (list[aims mesh | PyMesh]) – a list of meshes to be drawn
  • cols (int, optional) – Number of columns in the subplot. Defaults to 3.
Returns:

the complete figure
Return type:

plotly.graphic_objects.Figure
colorado.mesh.draw_numpy_meshes(list_of_vertices, list_of_polygons, labels=None)¶

Draw meshes from the vertices and polygons of the mesh. The meshes are drown in the same figure.

Parameters:
  • list_of_vertices (list[numpy.array]) – lists of array of points.
  • list_of_polygons (list[numpy.array]) – lists of array of points.
  • labels (list[str], optional) – list of plots labels. Defaults to None.
Returns:

the complete figure
Return type:

plotly.graphic_objects.Figure

colorado.mesh.get_mesh3d_g_o(vertices, polygons, name=None, shift=(0, 0, 0), **kwargs)¶

Get an plotly graphic object from numpy arrays

Parameters:
  • vertices (numpy.ndarray) – Nx3 array of points representing the vertices
  • polygons (numpy.ndarray) – Nx3 array of points representing the polygons
  • name (str, optional) – The plot name. Defaults to None.
Returns:

a graphic pbject
Return type:

plotly.graph_objects

Module contents¶

colorado.draw(data, fig=None, labels=None, shift=(0, 0, 0), **kwargs)¶

Draw objects with plotly

Parameters:
  • data (soma.aims mesh/volume/bucket) – an object or a list of objects. Object can be an aims bucket, an aims Mesh or a PyMesh
  • fig (plotly.graph_objects.Figure, optional) – the plotly figure, if None, one is created, defaults to None
  • labels (list[str], optional) – an array of labels for the data if data is a list, defaults to None
  • shift (tuple, optional) – shift the plots in data each by (x,y,z), defaults to (0,0,0)
Returns:

a plotly figure
Return type:

plotly.graph_objects.Figure
